utterance: ATDD - acceptance test-driven development
BDD - behavior-driven development
BRD - business requirement documents
DA - Disciplined Agile
DoD - definition of done
DoR - definition of ready
DSDM - Dynamic Systems Development Method
Evo - evolutionary value delivery
LeSS - Large-Scale Scrum
LSD - Lean Software Development
PDCA - Plan-Do-Check-Act
PMO - project management office
ROI - return on investment
RUP - rational unified process
SAFe - Scaled Agile Framework
SBE - specification by example
XP - eXtreme Programming
TBD - to be determined

The purpose of Project Management is to identify and control the activities, and establish resources necessary for a project to develop a product, in the context of the project's requirements and constraints.

Slots.subject: The purpose of Project Management
Slots.object: identification and control of activities and establishment of resources necessary to develop a product within project constraints

utterance: The scope of the work for the project is defined.

Slots.subject: Project Management process outcomes
Slots.object: scope of the work for the project

utterance: The feasibility of achieving the goals of the project with available resources and constraints is evaluated.
The activities and resources necessary to complete the work are sized and estimated.

Slots.subject: Project Management process outcomes
Slots.object: activities and resources necessary to complete the work

utterance: Interfaces within the project, and with other projects and organizational units, are identified and monitored.

Slots.subject: Project Management process outcomes
Slots.object: interfaces within the project and with other organizational units

utterance: Plans for the execution of the project are developed, implemented and maintained.
Progress of the project is monitored and reported.
Adjustment is performed when project goals are not achieved.
MAN.3. Best Practice 1: Define the scope of work. Identify the project's goals, motivation and boundaries.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: definition of the scope of work, identification of the project's goals, motivation and boundaries

Notes.utterance: This may include the alignment of the project life cycle with the customer's development process.

utterance: MAN.3. Base Practice 2: Define project life cycle. Define the life cycle for the project, which is appropriate to the scope, context, and complexity of the project. Define a release scope for relevant milestones.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: definition of the project life cycle appropriate to its scope, context, and complexity, and definition of the release scope for relevant milestones

Notes.utterance: This may include the alignment of the project life cycle with the customer's development process.

Slots.subject: This
Slots.object: alignment of the project life cycle with the customer's development process

utterance: MAN.3. Base Practice 3: Evaluate feasibility of the project.
MAN.3. Base Practice 3: Evaluate feasibility of the project. Evaluate the feasibility of achieving the goals of the project with respect to time, project estimates, and available resources.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: evaluation of the feasibility of achieving project goals considering time, estimates, and available resources

Notes.utterance: The evaluation of feasibility may consider technical constraints of the project.

Slots.subject: The evaluation of feasibility in MAN.3.BP3

utterance: MAN.3. Base Practice 4: Define and monitor work packages and their dependencies according to defined project life cycle and estimations.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.condition: according to defined project life cycle and estimations

utterance: MAN.3 Base Practice 5: Define and monitor project estimates and resources.
MAN.3 Base Practice 5: Define and monitor project estimates of effort and resources based on project's goals, project risks, motivation and boundaries.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: project estimates of effort and resources
Slots.condition: based on project's goals, project risks, motivation and boundaries

utterance: MAN.3 Base Practice 6: Define and monitor required skills, knowledge, and experience.

MAN.3 Base Practice 6: Define and monitor required skills, knowledge, and experience. Identify and monitor the required skills, knowledge, and experience for the project in line with the estimates and work packages.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: required skills, knowledge, and experience for the project
Slots.condition: in line with the estimates and work packages

utterance: MAN.3 Base Practice 7: Define and monitor project interfaces and agreed commitments.

MAN.3 Base Practice 7: Define and monitor project interfaces and agreed commitments. Identify and agree interfaces of the project with affected stakeholders and monitor agreed commitments. Define an escalation mechanism for commitments that are not fulfilled.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.additional_object: escalation mechanism for commitments that are not fulfilled
Slots.condition: interfaces and commitments are to be managed with affected stakeholders

utterance: Define and monitor project schedule.
MAN.3 Base Practice 8: Define and monitor project schedule. Allocate resources to work packages and schedule each activity of the project. Monitor the performance of activities against schedule.
MAN.3 Base Practice 9: Ensure consistency.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.object: consistency of project plans, activities, and outcomes

utterance: Base Practice MAN.3.BP10: Review and report progress of the project.

Base Practice MAN.3.BP10: Review and report progress of the project. Regularly review and report the status of the project and the fulfillment of work packages against estimated effort and duration to all affected parties. Prevent recurrence of identified problems.

Slots.subject: Project Management process
Slots.condition: against estimated effort and duration; reporting to all affected parties
